meanings.definition: Lacking eyes or the ability to see.
meanings.sent1: The eyeless doll sat on the shelf, unable to see the world around it.
meanings.sent2: The blindfolded man stumbled around the room, feeling eyeless in the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The eyeless potato tried to watch TV but couldn't see the screen.
meanings.sent4: The eyeless night enveloped the forest, shrouding everything in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The eyeless cave seemed to swallow all light, leaving only shadows behind.

meanings.sent1: The eyeless fish swam blindly in the murky waters, relying on other senses.
meanings.sent2: The eyeless statue stood in the garden, a silent sentinel in the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The eyeless robot mistook a rock for a person, showing its lack of visual perception.
meanings.sent4: The eyeless night sky sparkled with stars, unseen by those without eyes.
meanings.sent5: The eyeless void of space stretched endlessly, devoid of any visual cues.
